trans-unit.source: disabledTitle The text to used when the link is disabled. This defaults to the same text at the active link. Setting to false will cause this method to return ''.
dmy 27-12-2006 or 27-12-06 separators can be a space, period, dash, forward slash
domain - The domain that the cookie is available. To make the cookie available on all subdomains of example.com set domain to '.example.com'.
domain: Domain the cookie is for.
duration Specify how long items in this cache configuration last.
element - Flash element to use, defaults to 'default'.
element - The element to wrap the formatted time in. Has a few additional options:
element The element used to render the flash message. Default to 'default'.
ellipsis Will be used as Beginning and prepended to the trimmed string
ellipsis Will be used as Ending and appended to the trimmed string
ellipsis Will be used as beginning and prepended to the trimmed string
ellipsis Will be used as ending and appended to the trimmed string
empty - If true, the empty select option is shown. If a string,
empty - If true, the empty select option is shown. If a string, that string is displayed as the empty element.
empty - Set to true to create an input with the value '' as the first option. When true the radio label will be 'empty'. Set this option to a string to control the label value.

empty - Set to true to add an empty option at the top of the option elements. Set to a string to define the display text of the empty option. If an array is used the key will set the value of the empty option while, the value will set the display text.
empty - Set to true to add an empty option at the top of the option elements. Set to a string to define the display value of the empty option.
empty - String or boolean to enable empty select box options.
enableBeforeRedirect - Set to false to disable the beforeRedirect callback. The beforeRedirect functionality has been deprecated.
encoding Encoding of XML document. If null remove from XML header. Default is the some of application.
encoding Set the accept-charset encoding for the form. Defaults to Configure::read('App.encoding')
encryption - Type of encryption to use. Defaults to 'aes'.
enctype Set the form encoding explicitly. By default type => file will set enctype to multipart/form-data.
end => The end of relative date telling
end => The end of relative time telling
end The hour to stop the options at.
engine Class name to use to replace Cake\I18n\Number functionality The class needs to be placed in the Utility directory.
engine Class name to use to replace String functionality. The class needs to be placed in the Utility directory.
entity The entity this context is operating on.
environment $_SERVER and $_ENV data.
error - Control the error message that is produced. Set to false to disable any kind of error reporting (field error and error messages).
error Error messages.
errorField: The name of the entity field that will be marked as invalid if the rule does not pass.
errors An array of validation errors. Errors should be nested following the dot separated paths you access your fields with.
escape - HTML entity encode the $title of the button. Defaults to false.
escape - If true contents of options will be HTML entity encoded. Defaults to true.
escape - Set to false to turn off escaping of label text. Defaults to true.
escape - Set to false to disable HTML escaping.
escape - Set to false to prevent escaping
escape - Whether or not the contents of the textarea should be escaped. Defaults to true.
escape - Whether or not to escape html in resulting string
escape Control HTML escaping of input. Defaults to true.
escape Defines if the title field for the link should be escaped (default: true).
escape Set to false to allow templates to print out HTML content
escape Set to false to disable HTML escaping.
escape Set to false to disable escaping of title and attributes.
escape Set to false to disable escaping on all attributes.
escape Set to true to enable escaping on all attributes.
escape Whether or not the contents should be html_entity escaped.
escape Whether or not to HTML escape the text.
escape Whether you want the contents html entity encoded, defaults to true
escape Whether you want the contents html entity encoded, defaults to true.
escape boolean - Whether or not to html escape the contents of the error.
escape: If false, the URL will be returned unescaped, do only use if it is manually escaped afterwards before being displayed.
escapeTitle Set to false to disable escaping of title. Takes precedence over value of escape)
even - Class to use for even rows.
exact If false, $text will not be cut mid-word
expire: Time the cookie expires in
expires - How long the cookies should last for. Defaults to 1 month.
expiry A strotime compatible value of how long the CSRF token should last. Defaults to browser session.
ext Asset extension to append
extended - Disallow bytes higher within the basic multilingual plane. MySQL's older utf8 encoding type does not allow characters above the basic multilingual plane. Defaults to false.
extensions - The extensions to connect when adding routes.
extensions The extensions to enable in this scope. Defaults to the globally enabled extensions set with Router::extensions()
field The form field to check. Changing this will also require configuring FormHelper.
fields The fields to use to identify a user by.
fields: An array with the fields that should be fetched from the association.
file Log file name
files Uploaded file data formatted like $_FILES.

finder The finder method to use to fetch user record. Defaults to 'all'. You can set finder name as string or an array where key is finder name and value is an array passed to Table::find() options. E.g. ['finderName' => ['some_finder_option' => 'some_value']]
finder: The finder to use when loading associated records. Either the name of the finder as a string, or an array to define options to pass to the finder.
first (default False) True to generate meta for first page

first Whether you want first links generated, set to an integer to define the number of 'first' links to generate. If a string is set a link to the first page will be generated with the value as the title.
firstClass Class for wrapper tag on the first breadcrumb, defaults to 'first'
fixed Whether or not the column is a fixed length column. This is only present/valid with string columns.
flash - Settings to use when Auth needs to do a flash message with FlashComponent::set(). Available keys are:
for - Set the for attribute, if its not defined the for attribute will be generated from the $fieldName parameter using FormHelper::_domId().
forceRefresh - Set to true to force rebuilding the cached metadata. Defaults to false.

foreignKey: Used to set a different field to match both tables, if set to false no join conditions will be generated automatically. false can only be used on joinable associations and cannot be used with hasMany or belongsToMany associations.
form - Array with any option that FormHelper::create() can take
format - By default both, can be long and lat as well to validate only a part of the coordinate.
format - The format you want the return. Defaults to the currently selected format. If format is 'array' or 'points' the return will be an array.
format => a fall back format if the relative time is longer than the duration specified by end
format If create childs ('tags') or attributes ('attributes').
format Set to 12 or 24 to use 12 or 24 hour formatting. Defaults to 24.

format The format string you want to use, defaults to 'pages' Which generates output like '1 of 5' set to 'range' to generate output like '1 - 3 of 13'. Can also be set to a custom string, containing the following placeholders {{page}}, {{pages}}, {{current}}, {{count}}, {{model}}, {{start}}, {{end}} and any custom content you would like.
format The piece of HTML with that the phrase will be highlighted
format option which accepts 12 or 24, allowing you to indicate which hour format you want.
fractionPosition - The position the fraction symbol should be placed valid options are 'before' & 'after'.
fractionSymbol - The currency symbol to use for fractional numbers.
from => another Date object representing the "now" date
from => another Time object representing the "now" time
from The directory to copy from, this will cause a cd() to occur, changing the results of pwd().
fullBase Boolean true or a string (e.g. https://example) to return full URL with protocol and domain name.
fullBase If provided the src attribute will get a full address including domain name
fullBase If true the URL will get a full address for the css file.
fullBase If true the src attribute will get a full address for the image file.
fullBase If true the url will get a full address for the script file.
fullBase: If true, the full base URL will be prepended to the result
groups List of groups or 'tags' associated to every key stored in this config. handy for deleting a complete group from cache.
hashOptions - Associative array of options. Check the PHP manual for supported options for each hash type. Defaults to empty array.
hashType - Hashing algo to use. Valid values are those supported by $algo argument of password_hash(). Defaults to PASSWORD_DEFAULT
help - Help text for the subcommand.
help - Help text for this option. Used when generating help for the option.
help The help text to display for this argument.
hiddenField - Set to false to remove the hidden field that ensures a value is always submitted.
hiddenField - boolean to indicate if you want the results of checkbox() to include a hidden input with a value of ''.
hiddenField - boolean to indicate if you want the results of radio() to include a hidden input with a value of ''. This is useful for creating radio sets that are non-continuous.
hour - Array of options for the hour select box.
html If true, HTML entities will be handled as decoded characters.
html If true, HTML tags would be handled correctly
html If true, will ignore any HTML tags, ensuring that only the correct text is highlighted
httpOnly - Set to true to make HTTP only cookies. Cookies that are HTTP only are not accessible in JavaScript. Default false.
httpOnly Whether or not the cookie will be set with the HttpOnly flag. Defaults to false.
httpOnly: Is the cookie available in the client?
id - mixed - If true it will be auto generated based on field name.
idPath The path to a key that identifies each entry. Should be compatible with Hash::extract(). Defaults to {n}.$alias.id
idPrefix Prefix for generated ID attributes.
ignoreMissing - boolean - Set to true to ignore missing bootstrap/routes files.
indent Indent the text with the string provided. Defaults to null.
indent String to indent with. Defaults to null.
indentAt 0 based index to start indenting at. Defaults to 0.
index The index for the arg, if left undefined the argument will be put onto the end of the arguments. If you define the same index twice the first option will be overwritten.
info Informational messages.
input The data that would come from php://input this is useful for simulating requests with put, patch or delete data.
input The input that can be formatted into the label if the template allows it.
inputTypeMap - A mapping between types and deserializers for request bodies. If undefined json & xml will be mapped. Defining any types will omit the defaults.
interval The interval for the minutes select. Defaults to 1
interval The interval that minute options should be created at.
interval The interval to round options to.
isWindows Automatically populated with whether the host is windows or not
json Set to false to disable json body parsing.
key - Encryption key used when encrypted cookies are enabled. Defaults to Security.salt.
key - Session key used to store user record.
key - The message domain to use for flashes generated by this component, defaults to 'auth'.
key The key to set under the session's Flash key
label - Either false to disable label around the widget or an array of attributes for the label tag. selected will be added to any classes e.g. 'class' => 'myclass' where widget is checked
label - Either a string label, or an array of options for the label. See FormHelper::label().
label - Either false to disable label generation, or an array of attributes for all labels.
label Used to generate the label for a radio button. Can use the following variables attrs, text and input.

labelOptions - Either false to disable label around nestedWidgets e.g. radio, multicheckbox or an array of attributes for the label tag. selected will be added to any classes e.g. class => 'myclass' where widget is checked
last (default False) True to generate meta for last page

last Whether you want last links generated, set to an integer to define the number of 'last' links to generate. If a string is set a link to the last page will be generated with the value as the title.
lastClass Class for wrapper tag on current active page, defaults to 'last'
length The length of the column.
levels string or array, levels the engine is interested in
limit - The initial number of items per page. Defaults to 20.
limit A limit, optional, defaults to -1 (none)
loadEntities Defaults to false. Set to true to enable loading of <!ENTITY definitions. This is disabled by default for security reasons.
locale - The locale name to use for formatting the number, e.g. fr_FR
locale - The locale name to use for parsing the number, e.g. fr_FR
locale Compare items as strings, based on the current locale
locale: The locale name to use for formatting the number, e.g. fr_FR
lock Lock direction. Will only use the default direction then, defaults to false.
lock Used by FileCache. Should files be locked before writing to them?
log Enable logging of exceptions.
loginAction - A URL (defined as a string or array) to the controller action that handles logins. Defaults to /users/login.

loginRedirect - Normally, if a user is redirected to the loginAction page, the location they were redirected from will be stored in the session so that they can be redirected back after a successful login. If this session value is not set, redirectUrl() method will return the URL specified in loginRedirect.

logoutRedirect - The default action to redirect to after the user is logged out. While AuthComponent does not handle post-logout redirection, a redirect URL will be returned from AuthComponent::logout(). Defaults to loginAction.
main() method.
mask A mask is applied when log files are created. Left empty no chmod is made.
mask The mask used for created database
mask The mask used for created files
maxLimit - The maximum limit users can choose to view. Defaults to 100
maxSize - The maximum file size in bytes. Defaults to not checking.
maxYear The max year to appear in the select element.
maxYear The maximum year to use in the year select
mdy 12-27-2006 or 12-27-06 separators can be a space, period, dash, forward slash
meridian - Set to true to enable the meridian input. Defaults to false. The meridian will be enabled automatically if you choose a 12 hour format.
message individual error message for field
message: The error message to set to errorField if the rule does not pass.
method - Request method to use. Set to 'delete' or others to simulate HTTP/1.1 DELETE (or others) request. Defaults to 'post'.
method - Request method to use. Set to 'delete' to simulate HTTP/1.1 DELETE request. Defaults to 'post'.
method Set the form's method attribute explicitly.
methods The HTTP methods to parse on. Defaults to PUT, POST, PATCH DELETE.
middleware - The names of the middleware routes should have applied.
minSize - The minimum file size in bytes. Defaults to not checking.
minYear The lowest year to use in the year select
minYear The min year to appear in the select element.
minute - Array of options for the minute select box.
mixed Formatted stack trace
mixed The same $var that was passed
mixed Wrapped text.
mixed the same $var that was passed to this function
mode The mode to copy the files/directories with as integer, e.g. 0775.
mode individual mode for field
model Model to create numbers for, defaults to PaginatorHelper::defaultModel()
model The model to use defaults to PaginatorHelper::defaultModel()
model The model to use, defaults to PaginatorHelper::defaultModel()
model The model to use, defaults to PaginatorHelper::defaultModel().
model The model to use, defaults to PaginatorHelper::defaultModel();
model The name of the model.
modulus How many numbers to include on either side of the current page, defaults to 8. Set to false to disable and to show all numbers.
month - Array of options for the month select box.
monthNames - If false, 2 digit numbers will be used instead of text. If an array, the given array will be used.
monthNames If false, 2 digit numbers will be used instead of text. If an array, the given array will be used.
multibytePattern Set to true to enable multibyte pattern support in route parameter patterns.
multicheckboxTitle Renders the title element for grouped inputs.
multicheckboxWrapper Renders a wrapper around grouped inputs.
multiple - The option can be provided multiple times. The parsed option will be an array of values when this option is enabled.
multiple - show a multiple select box. If set to 'checkbox' multiple checkboxes will be created instead.
multiply: Multiply the input value by 100 for decimal percentages.
my 12/2006 or 12/06 separators can be a space, period, dash, forward slash
name - Set the input name.
name - The name of the input.
name The name attribute of the inputs to create. [] will be appended to the name.
name The name attribute.
namePrefix - The prefix to prepend to all route names.
natural Compare items as strings using "natural ordering" in a human friendly way Will sort foo10 below foo2 as an example.

nestedInput - Used with checkbox and radio inputs. Set to false to render inputs outside of label elements. Can be set to true on any input to force the input inside the label. If you enable this option for radio buttons you will also need to modify the default radioWrapper template.
next (default True) True to generate meta for next page
nonceLifetime The number of seconds that nonces are valid for. Defaults to 300.
null Whether or not the column can hold nulls.
numeric Compare values numerically
odd - Class to use for odd rows.
once Whether or not the css file should be checked for uniqueness. If true css files will only be included once, use false to allow the same css to be included more than once per request.
once Whether or not the script should be checked for uniqueness. If true scripts will only be included once, use false to allow the same script to be included more than once per request.
opaque A string that must be returned unchanged by clients. Defaults to md5($config['realm'])
optional - Whether or not this file is optional. Defaults to false. If true a missing file will pass the validator regardless of other constraints.
options - Additional options for the memcached client. Should be an array of option => value. Use the \Memcached::OPT_* constants as keys.
options - An array of options.
options - An array of options. See below for more information.
options - For widgets that take options e.g. radio, select.
options An array of options to create checkboxes out of.
options An associative array of value=>labels to generate options for.
orderYear - Order of year values in select options. Possible values 'asc', 'desc'. Default 'desc'.
orderYear - Ordering of year values in select options. Possible values 'asc', 'desc'. Default 'desc'
outputAs integer or ConsoleOutput::[RAW|PLAIN|COLOR]
page - The starting page, defaults to 1.
params - The array of additional params to use, defaults to ['class' => 'error']
params An array of variables to make available when using an element
parentPath The path to a key that identifies the parent of each entry. Should be compatible with Hash::extract(). Defaults to {n}.$alias.parent_id
parseHuge Enable the LIBXML_PARSEHUGE flag.
parser - A ConsoleOptionParser for the subcommand. This allows you to create method specific option parsers. When help is generated for a subcommand, if a parser is present it will be used.
pass - Copies the listed parameters into params['pass'].
pass is used to define which of the routed parameters should be shifted into the pass array. Adding a parameter to pass will remove it from the regular route array. Ex. 'pass' => ['slug'].
password Password to access the Memcache server
password Redis server password.
passwordHasher Password hasher class. Can be a string specifying class name or an array containing className key, any other keys will be passed as config to the class. Defaults to 'Default'.

path - The path on the server in which the cookie will be available on. If path is set to '/foo/', the cookie will only be available within the /foo/ directory and all sub-directories such as /foo/bar/ of domain. The default value is base path of app. For e.g. if your app is running under a subfolder "cakeapp" of document root the path would be "/cakeapp/" else it would be "/".
path - string - The path the plugin can be found on. If empty the default plugin path (App.pluginPaths) will be used.
path Path to where cachefiles should be saved. Defaults to system's temp dir.
path The path to save logs on.
path: Path the cookie applies to
pathPrefix Path prefix for relative URLs
pathPrefix Path prefix to use for relative URLs, defaults to 'files/'
pattern - An ICU number pattern to use for formatting the number. e.g #,##0.00
persist Passes the params to the redirected route, if it can. This is useful with greedy routes, routes that end in * are greedy. As you can remap URLs and not lose any passed args.

persist is used to define which route parameters should be automatically included when generating new URLs. You can override persistent parameters by redefining them in a URL or remove them by setting the parameter to false. Ex. 'persist' => ['lang']
persistent Connect to the Redis server with a persistent connection
persistent The name of the persistent connection. All configurations using the same persistent value will share a single underlying connection.
places - Minimum number or decimals to use, e.g 0
places - Number of decimal places to use. e.g. 2
plugin False value will prevent parsing path as a plugin
port port number to the Redis server.
post POST data or non query string data
precision - Maximum Number of decimal places to use, e.g. 2
precision The number of decimal places to store for float and decimal types.
prefix Prefix appended to all entries. Good for when you need to share a keyspace with either another cache config or another application.
prefix Prepended to all entries. Good for when you need to share a keyspace with either another cache config or another application.
preserve: Specific non-word character to preserve. Default null. For e.g. this option can be set to '.' to generate clean file names.
pretty Returns formatted Xml when set to true. Defaults to false
prev (default True) True to generate meta for previous page
probability Probability of hitting a cache gc cleanup. Setting to 0 will disable cache::gc from ever being called automatically.
qop Defaults to 'auth', no other values are supported at this time.
query Additional data from the query string.
queryBuilder: Equivalent to passing a callable instead of an options array.
question Magenta text used for user prompts
radio Used to generate the input for a radio button. Can use the following variables name, value, attrs.
radioWrapper Used to generate the container element for the radio + input element. Can use the input and label variables.

readFile Set to false to disable file reading. This is important to disable when putting user data into Xml::build(). If enabled local files will be read if they exist. Defaults to true for backwards compatibility reasons.
realm The realm authentication is for, Defaults to the servername.
recursive Whether to copy recursively or not (default: true - recursive)
redirect - Session key used to store redirect URL.
references The table, column a foreign key references.
regex A custom regex rule that is used to match words, default is '|$tag|iu'
regular For regular sorting (don't change types)
rel Defaults to 'stylesheet'. If equal to 'import' the stylesheet will be imported.
relativeString => The printf compatible string when outputting relative time
relativeString => The printf compatible string when outputting relative date
relativeString => The printf compatible string when outputting relative time
replacement: Replacement string. Default '-'.
requireAuth - List of actions that require a valid authentication key. Deprecated as of 3.2.2
requireSecure - List of actions that require an SSL-secured connection.
required - Set to true to add the required attribute on all generated radios.
required A nested array of fields, relationships and boolean flags to indicate a field is required. The value can also be a string to be used as the required error message
required Whether this parameter is required.
return Can be 'simplexml' to return object of SimpleXMLElement or 'domdocument' to return DOMDocument.
return If return object of SimpleXMLElement ('simplexml') or DOMDocument ('domdocument'). Default is SimpleXMLElement.
root The id of the desired top-most result.
rotate Log files are rotated specified times before being removed. If value is 0, old versions are removed rather then rotated.
round - Set to up or down if you want to force rounding in either direction. Defaults to null.
round Accepts up or down. Defines which direction the current value should be rounded to match the select options.
round How you want the value rounded when it does not fit neatly into an interval. Accepts 'up', 'down', and null.
routeClass - The default route class to use when adding routes.
routeClass The route class to use in this scope. Defaults to Router::defaultRouteClass()
routeClass is used to extend and change how individual routes parse requests and handle reverse routing, via a custom routing class. Ex. 'routeClass' => 'SlugRoute'
routes - boolean - Whether or not you want to load the $plugin/config/routes.php file.
safe (boolean) Whether or not the $script should be wrapped in <![CDATA[ ]]>. Defaults to false.
safe (boolean) Whether or not the $script should be wrapped in <![CDATA[ ]]>. See scriptBlock().

schema An array of data that emulate the column structures that Cake\Database\Schema\Schema uses. This array allows you to control the inferred type for fields and allows auto generation of attributes like maxlength, step and other HTML attributes. If you want primary key/id detection to work. Make sure you have provided a _constraints array that contains primary. See below for an example.
schemaDefault: Boolean indicating whether default value from context's schema should be used if it's not explicitly provided.
scheme Folder::MERGE, Folder::OVERWRITE, Folder::SKIP
scopes string or array, scopes the engine is interested in
second - Set to true to enable the seconds input. Defaults to false.
second Set to true to enable seconds drop down.
secret The secret to use for nonce validation. Defaults to Security::getSalt().
secure - Indicates that the cookie should only be transmitted over a secure HTTPS connection. When set to true, the cookie will only be set if a secure connection exists.
secure - boolean whether or not the field should be added to the security fields. Disabling the field using the disabled option, will also omit the field from being part of the hashed key.
secure Whether or not the cookie will be set with the Secure flag. Defaults to false.
secure: Is the cookie https?
separator Separator content to insert in between breadcrumbs, defaults to ''
separator The string to use as a separator. Defaults to :.
serialize Should cache objects be serialized first.
serialize The serializer engine used to serialize data. Available engines are php, igbinary and json. Beside php, the memcached extension must be compiled with the appropriate serializer support.
server URL or ip to the Redis server host.
servers String or array of memcached servers. If an array MemcacheEngine will use them as a pool.
session An instance of a Session object
short - The single letter variant for this option, leave undefined for none.
shutdown(Event $event) Called after the action is complete and the view has been rendered but before Controller::afterFilter().

size Used to implement basic log file rotation. If log file size reaches specified size the existing file is renamed by appending timestamp to filename and new log file is created. Can be integer bytes value or human readable string values like '10MB', '100KB' etc.
skip Files/directories to skip.
skipLog List of exceptions to skip logging. Exceptions that extend one of the listed exceptions will also not be logged. Example:
start - The stack frame to start generating a trace from. Defaults to 0
start - The stack frame to start generating a trace from. Defaults to 1
start The hour to start the options at.
startup(Event $event) Called after the controller's beforeFilter method, and before the controller action is called.
status Sets the HTTP status (default 301)
storage - Storage class to use for persisting user record. When using stateless authenticator you should set this to 'Memory'. Defaults to 'Session'.
stream the path to save logs on.
string Compare values as strings
string Returns the class name or variable type
string string
string|boolean|null Environment variable setting.
string|null Plural form of translated string, or null if invalid.
string|null Plural form of translated string.
string|null The translated text, or null if invalid.
string|null Translated string.
table Define the table name to use. If undefined, this option will default to the underscored version of the alias name.

table Either the ORM\Table instance to fetch schema/validators from, an array of table instances in the case of a form spanning multiple entities, or the name(s) of the table. If this is null the table name(s) will be determined using naming conventions.
tag - The tag to use, defaults to 'span'.
tag - Type of list tag to use (ol/ul)
tag Type of media element to generate, either "audio" or "video". If tag is not provided it's guessed based on file's mime type.
templateVars - Additional template variables for the input element and its container.
templateVars Provide template variables for the formStart template.

templates - The templates you want to use for this input. Any templates will be merged on top of the already loaded templates. This option can either be a filename in /config that contains the templates you want to load, or an array of templates to use.

templates An array of templates, or template file name containing the templates you'd like to use when generating the link for next page. The helper's original templates will be restored once next() is done.

templates An array of templates, or template file name containing the templates you'd like to use when generating the link for previous page. The helper's original templates will be restored once prev() is done.
templates An array of templates, or template file name containing the templates you'd like to use when generating the numbers. The helper's original templates will be restored once numbers() is done.
templates Either a filename to a config containing templates. Or an array of templates to load. See Cake\View\StringTemplate for template formatting.

templates The templates you want to use for this form. Any templates will be merged on top of the already loaded templates. This option can either be a filename in /config that contains the templates you want to load, or an array of templates to use.
text Define the text/content for the link.
text Text to include inside the audio/video tag
text The text for the label.
text The text of the button. Unlike all other form controls, buttons do not escape their contents by default.
timeFormat The time format to use, either 12 or 24.
timeout timeout in seconds (float).

timestamp Overrides the value of Asset.timestamp in Configure. Set to false to skip timestamp generation. Set to true to apply timestamps when debug is true. Set to 'force' to always enable timestamping regardless of debug value.
timezone => The user timezone the timestamp should be formatted in.
title - Defaults to the $dateTime input.
to The directory to copy to.
total The total number of items in the progress bar. Defaults to 100.
trace Should error logs include stack traces?

transliteratorId: A valid transliterator id string. If null (default) the transliterator (identifier) set via setTransliteratorId() or setTransliterator() will be used. If false no transliteration will be done, only non words will be removed.
trimWidth If true, $text will be truncated with the width
trimWidth If true, the width will return.
trimWidth If true, will be truncated with specified width.
true on success, false otherwise.
type - A string of the coordinate format, right now only latLong.
type - Force the type of widget you want. e.g. type => 'select'
type - Set to 'reset' for reset inputs. Defaults to 'submit'
type - The formatter type to construct, set it to currency if you need to format numbers representing money or a NumberFormatter constant.
type - The formatter type to construct, set it to currency if you need to parse numbers representing money.
type Form method defaults to autodetecting based on the form context. If the form context's isCreate() method returns false, a PUT request will be done.
type The button type defaults to 'submit'.
type The type of constraint being added.
type The type of index being added.
type The type of the column. This should be one of CakePHP's abstract types.
types - An array of valid mime types. If empty all types will be accepted. The type will not be looked at, instead the file type will be checked with ext/finfo.
unauthorizedRedirect - Controls handling of unauthorized access.
unix_socket Path to the unix socket file (default: false)
unlockedActions - Actions to exclude from POST validation checks. Other checks like requireAuth(), requireSecure() etc. will still be applied.

unlockedFields - Form fields to exclude from POST validation. Fields can be unlocked either in the Component, or with FormHelper::unlockField(). Fields that have been unlocked are not required to be part of the POST and hidden unlocked fields do not have their values checked.
unsigned Whether or not the column is an unsigned column. This is only present/valid for integer, decimal, float columns.
update The behavior on update. Options are 'restrict', 'setNull', 'cascade', 'noAction'.
uri The PSR7 UriInterface object. If null, one will be created.
url An array of additional URL options to use for link generation.
url Define the target of the created link.
url If provided an image link will be generated and the link will point at $options['url'].
url The URL the form submits to. Can be a string or a URL array. If you use 'url' you should leave 'action' undefined.
url The URL without the base path for the request.
url Url of the action. See Router::url()
url['direction'] Direction of the sorting (default: 'asc').
url['page'] Page number to use in links.
url['sort'] the key that the recordset is sorted.
useIntlCode - Whether or not to replace the currency symbol with the international currency code.
userModel The alias for users table, defaults to Users.
username Login to access the Memcache server
val - A date time string, integer or DateTime object
val - A string of the option to mark as selected.
val - Either a string or an array of options to mark as selected.
val - The current value. If it matches value the checkbox will be checked. You can also use the 'checked' attribute to make the checkbox checked.
val Either a string/integer or array of values that should be checked. Can also be a complex options set.
val The selected value of the input.
val The value attribute.
validatePost - Whether to validate POST data. Set to false to disable for data coming from 3rd party services, etc.

validator Either the Validation\Validator to use, or the name of the validation method to call on the table object. For example 'default'. Defaults to 'default'. Can be an array of table alias=>validators when dealing with associated forms.
value - Indicates the value when this radio button is checked.
value - The value attribute. Defaults to '1'.
value - the value of the checkbox
value The selected value of the input.
value | default The default value to be used by the input. A value in $this->data matching the field name will override this value. If no default is provided time() will be used.
value: Value of the cookie
valueSources The sources that values should be read from. See FormHelper::setValueSources()
version Version of XML document. Default is 1.0.
viewClassMap - Mapping between type and view classes. If undefined json, xml, and ajax will be mapped. Defining any types will omit the defaults.
warnOnWriteFailures Some engines, such as ApcuEngine, may raise warnings on write failures.
warning Warning messages.
webroot The webroot directory for the request.
when individual when condition for field
whitelist - A list of parameters users are allowed to set using request parameters. Modifying this list will allow users to have more influence over pagination, be careful with what you permit.
width The width of the progress bar. Defaults to 80.
width The width to wrap to. Defaults to 72
width The width to wrap to. Defaults to 72.
wordWrap Only wrap on words breaks (spaces) Defaults to true.
xml Set to true to enable XML parsing. Defaults to false, as XML handling requires more care than JSON does.
y 2006 just the year without any separators
year - Array of options for the year select box.
ym 2006/12 or 06/12 separators can be a space, period, dash, forward slash
ymd 2006-12-27 or 06-12-27 separators can be a space, period, dash, forward slash
zero - The text to use for zero values, can be a string or a number. e.g. 0, 'Free!'
{*} Matches any value.
{n}.User.name Get the name of every user in the set of users.
trans-unit.target: {n}.User.name Get the name of every user in the set of users.

trans-unit.source: {n}.User[id>=2].name Get the name of every user with an id key greater than or equal to 2.
trans-unit.target: {n}.User[id>=2].name Get the name of every user with an id key greater than or equal to 2.

trans-unit.source: {n}.User[id=1].name Get the Users name with id matching 1.
trans-unit.target: {n}.User[id=1].name Get the Users name with id matching 1.

trans-unit.source: {n}.User[id].name Get the name of every user with an id key.
trans-unit.target: {n}.User[id].name Get the name of every user with an id key.

trans-unit.source: {n}.User[username=/^paul/] Get User elements with username matching ^paul.
trans-unit.target: {n}.User[username=/^paul/] Get User elements with username matching ^paul.

trans-unit.source: {n} Matches any numeric key, or integer.
trans-unit.target: {n} Matches any numeric key, or integer.

trans-unit.source: {s} Matches any string key.
Caveat You cannot properly encrypt/decrypt data with trailing null bytes. Any trailing null bytes will be removed on decryption due to how PHP pads messages with nulls prior to encryption.
Note: The following keys will have their contents replaced with *****:

Note If your $alias uses plugin syntax only the name part will be used as key in the registry. This means that if two plugins, or a plugin and app provide the same alias, the registry will only store the first instance.
Note The $allowedDomains, $allowedMethods, $allowedHeaders parameters are deprecated. Instead the builder object should be used.
Note This method will only provide access to cookies that were added as part of the constructor. If cookies are added post construction they will not be accessible via this method.
Note This method will trigger an error when view rendering has a problem. This is because PHP will not allow a __toString() method to throw an exception.
Note hidden properties are not visible, and will not be output by toArray().
Warning Replacing the Uri will not update the base, webroot, and url attributes.
Warning This method is not an robust solution in preventing XSS or malicious HTML.
Warning This method mutates the request in-place for backwards compatibility reasons, and is not part of the PSR7 interface.
Warning This method mutates the response in-place and should be avoided.
Note The view variable you specify must be compatible with Xml::fromArray().
Warning You cannot overwrite text that contains newlines.

A collection is an immutable list of elements with a handful of functions to iterate, group, transform and extract information from it.

A common use case is to re-use the same variable for calculating different data. In those cases it may be helpful and more performant to first compile a collection and then apply more operations to it.

Recognized keys are: - newRecord: (boolean) whether or not the data to be validated belongs to a new record - data: The full data that was passed to the validation process - field: The name of the field that is being processed

A key value list of data that could be used as context during validation. Recognized keys are: - newRecord: (boolean) whether or not the data to be validated belongs to a new record - data: The full data that was passed to the validation process - providers associative array with objects or class names that will be passed as the last argument for the validation method
A key-value list of conditions to match where the key is the property path to get from the current item and the value is the value to be compared the item with.
A lazy collection can only be iterated once. A second attempt results in an error.

Actions in CakePHP can be any public method on a controller, that is not declared in Controller. If you want controller methods to be public and in-accessible by URL, then prefix them with a _. For example public function _loadPosts() { } would not be accessible via URL. Private and protected methods are also not accessible via URL.

Additional HTML attributes of the DIV tag
Additional HTML attributes of the DIV tag, see above.
Additional HTML attributes of the P tag
Additional HTML attributes of the list (ol/ul) tag.
Additional arguments for cell method. e.g.: cell('TagCloud::smallList', ['a1' => 'v1', 'a2' => 'v2']) maps to View\Cell\TagCloud::smallList(v1, v2)
Additional conditions given to the query

Additional data to be used for logging the message. The special scope key can be passed to be used for further filtering of the log engines to be used. If a string or a numerically index array is passed, it will be treated as the scope key. See Cake\Log\Log::setConfig() for more information on logging scopes.
Additional debug info describing the cause
Additional information about the logged message
Additional log data relevant to this message.
Additional logging information for the message.
Additional options
Additional options for input generation.
Additional options for new links to be saved can be passed in the third argument, check Table::save() for information on the accepted options.
Additional options for the request.
Additional options parameters.
Additional options to use for the creation of this flash message. Supports the 'params', and 'element' keys that are used in the helper.
Additional options to use.
Additional options used when constructing the view.

Additional paths for Templates and Plugins are configured with Configure now. See config/app.php for an example. The App.paths.plugins and App.paths.templates variables are used to configure paths for plugins and templates respectively. All class based resources should be mapped using your application's autoloader.
Additional request options.
Additional settings to use when loading the object.
Additional template variables.
Additional to IntlDateFormatter constants and date formatting string you can use Time::UNIX_TIMESTAMP_FORMAT to get a unix timestamp
Additional type specific properties.
Additionally it creates a i18n HasMany association that will be used for fetching all translations for each record in the bound table
Additionally it will set an 'instance' key per association containing the association instance from the corresponding source table
Additionally to the default options accepted by Table::delete(), the following keys are supported:
Additions/edits to the class map to apply.
Address to send (see Cake\Mailer\Email::to()). If null, will try to use 'to' from transport config
Addresses to format.
Adds ORM related features to the RulesChecker class.
Adds a DISTINCT clause to the query to remove duplicates from the result set. This clause can only be used for select statements.
Adds a NOT IN condition or set of conditions to be used in the WHERE clause for this query.
Adds a base directory for a namespace prefix.

Adds a behavior to this table's behavior collection. Behaviors provide an easy way to create horizontally re-usable features that can provide trait like functionality, and allow for events to be listened to.
Adds a class and returns a unique list either in array or space separated

Adds a complete query to be used in conjunction with an UNION operator with this query. This is used to combine the result set of this query with the one that will be returned by the passed query. You can add as many queries as you required by calling multiple times this method with different queries.

Adds a complete query to be used in conjunction with the UNION ALL operator with this query. This is used to combine the result set of this query with the one that will be returned by the passed query. You can add as many queries as you required by calling multiple times this method with different queries.

Adds a condition or set of conditions to be used in the HAVING clause for this query. This method operates in exactly the same way as the method where() does. Please refer to its documentation for an insight on how to using each parameter.

Adds a condition or set of conditions to be used in the WHERE clause for this query. Conditions can be expressed as an array of fields as keys with comparison operators in it, the values for the array will be used for comparing the field to such literal. Finally, conditions can be expressed as a single string or an array of strings.
Adds a cookie to the Client collection.
Adds a field to the schema.

Adds a formatter function to the passed $query if the $surrogate query declares any other formatter. Since the $surrogate query correspond to the associated target table, the resulting formatter will be the result of applying the surrogate formatters to only the property corresponding to such table.
Adds a link to the breadcrumbs array.
Adds a location where tables should be looked for.
Adds a nested validator.

Adds a new association to the list that will be used to filter the results of any given query based on the results of finding records for that association. You can pass a dot separated path of associations to this method as its first parameter, this will translate in setting all those associations with the matching option.
Adds a new case expression to the expression object
Adds a new condition to the expression object in the form "EXISTS (...)".
Adds a new condition to the expression object in the form "NOT EXISTS (...)".
Adds a new condition to the expression object in the form "field != value".
Adds a new condition to the expression object in the form "field > value".
Adds a new condition to the expression object in the form "field >= value".
Adds a new condition to the expression object in the form "field < value".
Adds a new condition to the expression object in the form "field <= value".
Adds a new condition to the expression object in the form "field = value".
Adds a new condition to the expression object in the form "field BETWEEN from AND to".
Adds a new condition to the expression object in the form "field IN (value1, value2)".
Adds a new condition to the expression object in the form "field IS NOT NULL".
Adds a new condition to the expression object in the form "field IS NULL".
Adds a new condition to the expression object in the form "field LIKE value".
Adds a new condition to the expression object in the form "field NOT IN (value1, value2)".
Adds a new condition to the expression object in the form "field NOT LIKE value".
Adds a new listener to an event.
Adds a new rule to a field's rule set. If second argument is an array then rules list for the field will be replaced with second argument and third argument will be ignored.

Adds a new set of conditions to this level of the tree and negates the final result by prepending a NOT, it will look like "NOT ( (condition1) AND (conditions2) )" conjunction depends on the one currently configured for this object.
Adds a rule that will be applied to the entity both on create and update operations.
Adds a rule that will be applied to the entity on create operations.
Adds a rule that will be applied to the entity on delete operations.
Adds a rule that will be applied to the entity on update operations.
Adds a single INNER JOIN clause to the query.
Adds a single LEFT JOIN clause to the query.
Adds a single RIGHT JOIN clause to the query.
Adds a single or multiple SELECT modifiers to be used in the SELECT.
Adds a single or multiple fields to be used in the GROUP BY clause for this query. Fields can be passed as an array of strings, array of expression objects, a single expression or a single string.
Adds a single or multiple fields to be used in the ORDER clause for this query. Fields can be passed as an array of strings, array of expression objects, a single expression or a single string.

Adds a single or multiple tables to be used as JOIN clauses to this query. Tables can be passed as an array of strings, an array describing the join parts, an array with multiple join descriptions, or a single string.
Adds a single or multiple tables to be used in the FROM clause for this query. Tables can be passed as an array of strings, array of expression objects, a single expression or a single string.
Adds a timestamp to a file based resource based on the value of Asset.timestamp in Configure. If Asset.timestamp is true and debug is true, or Asset.timestamp === 'force' a timestamp will be added.
Adds additional event spies to the controller/view event manager.
Adds all the files in a directory to the test suite. Does not recursive through directories.
Adds an IN condition or set of conditions to be used in the WHERE clause for this query.
Adds an array of behaviors to the table's behavior collection.
Adds an event to the list if the event list object is present.
Adds an event to the list when event listing is enabled.
Adds custom inflection $rules, of either 'plural', 'singular', 'uninflected', 'irregular' or 'transliteration' $type.
Adds email links (<a href="mailto:....) to a given text.
Adds filtering conditions to this query to only bring rows that have a relation to another from an associated table, based on conditions in the associated table.
Adds filtering conditions to this query to only bring rows that have no match to another from an associated table, based on conditions in the associated table.
Adds fixtures to a test case when it starts.
Adds handy methods and locale-aware formatting helpers
Adds links (<a href=....) to a given text, by finding text that begins with strings like http:// and ftp://.
Adds new fields to be returned by a SELECT statement when this query is executed. Fields can be passed as an array of strings, array of expression objects, a single expression or a single string.
Adds one or more arguments for the function call.

Adds one or more conditions and their respective true values to the case object. Conditions must be a one dimensional array or a QueryExpression. The trueValues must be a similar structure, but may contain a string value.

Adds one or more conditions to this expression object. Conditions can be expressed in a one dimensional array, that will cause all conditions to be added directly at this level of the tree or they can be nested arbitrarily making it create more expression objects that will be nested inside and configured to use the specified conjunction.
Adds or replaces existing widget instances/configuration with new ones.
Adds string template functionality to any class by providing methods to load and parse string templates.
Adds the given class to the element options
Adjust $value based on rounding settings.
Advances the cursor one position
Advances the cursor to the next record
